body:
@TsvetanRangelov Thanks for filing this.

Can you elaborate what do you mean the interface crashes? Does the `mlflow ui` interface crashes? Do you any stacktrace? From what  read, it seems like the `mlflow ui` comes up okay and you can peruse and view the metric, but "crashes" when clicking on the model artifact.

Can you saving with `mlflow.pyfunc.log_model("pyfunc_model", python_model=a)`, where `pyfunc_model"` is just a directory name that will be created. Maybe the `''"` may be a problem.

https://www.mlflow.org/docs/latest/python_api/mlflow.pyfunc.html#mlflow.pyfunc.log_model
@TsvetanRangelov Can you open the dev console on the browser and check if there are error messages?

Oh, there actually is an error! Here is the stack trace

It looks like the error occurs in this line:

https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/add51b931951dfc77716da3bd04c87c3684b4f97/mlflow/server/js/src/experiment-tracking/reducers/Reducers.js#L292

@TsvetanRangelov 
How are you launching the `mflow ui`?  Are you using`mlflow ui --backend-store-uri postgresql://xx:xx@postgres/mlflow_db`?

I am launching a tracking server via:
`
mlflow server -p 8000 -h 0.0.0.0 --backend-store-uri postgresql://xx:xx@postgres/mlflow_db --default-artifact-root ftp://xx:xx@ftpserver/home/mlflow
`
and just opening it on localhost
same issue here, is there any update?
@TsvetanRangelov Can you share your docker file?

```
version: '3'
services:
  ftpserver:
    image: fauria/vsftpd:latest
    volumes:
      - /path/to/volume/:/home/mlflow
    expose:
      - "21000-21010"
    environment:
      PASV_ADDRESS_ENABLE: "YES"
      PASV_ADDRESS: ftpserver
      FTP_USER: mlflow
      PASV_ADDR_RESOLVE: "YES"
      FTP_PASS: 123
    restart: on-failure
  postgres:
    image: postgres
    restart: always
    environment:
      POSTGRES_USER: mlflow_user
      POSTGRES_PASSWORD: example
      POSTGRES_DB: mlflow_db
  training:
    build:
      context: .
      dockerfile: Dockerfile
    depends_on:
      - postgres
      - ftpserver
    command: mlflow server -p 8000 -h 0.0.0.0 --backend-store-uri postgresql://mlflow_user:example@postgres/mlflow_db --default-artifact-root ftp://mlflow:123@ftpserver/home/mlflow
    expose:
     - "8000"
    ports:
      - "8000:8000"
  test:
    depends_on:
      - postgres
      - training
      - ftpserver
    build:
      context: .
      dockerfile: Dockerfile
    command: bash -c "python example_model.py"
```


in example_model.py:
```
import mlflow
import mlflow.pyfunc

class ExampleModel(mlflow.pyfunc.PythonModel):
    def __init__(self):
        pass
    def predict(self, context, data):
        return 1

mlflow.tracking.set_tracking_uri("http://localhost:8000")
loc = mlflow.get_artifact_uri()


mlflow.end_run()

example_model = ExampleModel()

with mlflow.start_run(run_name="example_name"):
    mlflow.log_metric("1", 1)
    mlflow.pyfunc.log_model("model", python_model=example_model)


```


Dockerfiles just set up libraries nothing much
